verses.text_plain: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.
verses.verse_html: 1The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

tokens.definition: ὁ ho, ho; the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom):—the, this, that, one, he, she, it, etc.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: which (413x), who (79x), the things (11x), the son (8x), miscellaneous (32x).
outline: the, this, that, these, etc. Only significant renderings other than "the, this, that, these" are counted in the KJV Translation Count above

tokens.definition: πρεσβύτερος presbýteros, pres-boo'-ter-os; comparative of πρέσβυς présbys (elderly); older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist (also figuratively, member of the celestial council) or Christian "presbyter":—elder(-est), old.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: elder (64x), old man (1x), eldest (1x), elder woman (1x).
outline: elder, of age, the elder of two people advanced in life, an elder, a senior forefathers
the elder of two people
advanced in life, an elder, a senior forefathers
forefathers

a term of rank or office among the Jews members of the great council or Sanhedrin (because in early times the rulers of the people, judges, etc., were selected from elderly men) of those who in separate cities managed public affairs and administered justice among the Christians, those who presided over the assemblies (or churches) The NT uses the term bishop, elders, and presbyters interchangeably the twenty four members of the heavenly Sanhedrin or court seated on thrones around the throne of God

among the Jews members of the great council or Sanhedrin (because in early times the rulers of the people, judges, etc., were selected from elderly men) of those who in separate cities managed public affairs and administered justice
members of the great council or Sanhedrin (because in early times the rulers of the people, judges, etc., were selected from elderly men)
of those who in separate cities managed public affairs and administered justice
among the Christians, those who presided over the assemblies (or churches) The NT uses the term bishop, elders, and presbyters interchangeably
the twenty four members of the heavenly Sanhedrin or court seated on thrones around the throne of God

tokens.definition: ἀγαπητός agapētós, ag-ap-ay-tos'; from G25 ; beloved:—(dearly, well) beloved, dear.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: beloved (47x), dearly beloved (9x), well beloved (3x), dear (3x).
outline: beloved, esteemed, dear, favourite, worthy of love

tokens.definition: Γάϊος Gáïos, gah'-ee-os; of Latin origin; Gaius (i.e. Caius), a Christian:—Gaius.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: Gaius (of Corinth) (2x), Gaius (of Macedonia) (1x), Gaius (of Derbe) (1x), Gaius (a Christian) (1x).
outline: Gaius = "lord" a Macedonian who accompanied Paul in his travels a man from Derbe who went with Paul from Corinth in his last journey to Jerusalem a man of Corinth who was his host in his second sojourn in that city an unknown Christian to whom John's third epistle is addressed
a Macedonian who accompanied Paul in his travels
a man from Derbe who went with Paul from Corinth in his last journey to Jerusalem
a man of Corinth who was his host in his second sojourn in that city
an unknown Christian to whom John's third epistle is addressed

tokens.definition: ὅς hós, hos; probably a primary word (or perhaps a form of the article G3588 ); the relatively (sometimes demonstrative) pronoun, who, which, what, that:—one, (an-, the) other, some, that, what, which, who(-m, -se), etc. See also G3757 .
tokens.kjv_translation_count: which (418x), whom (270x), that (139x), who (87x), whose (52x), what (40x), that which (20x), whereof (17x), miscellaneous (346x).
outline: who, which, what, that

tokens.definition: ἐγώ egṓ, eg-o'; a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):—I, me. For the other cases and the plural see G1691 , G1698 , G1700 , G2248 , G2249 , G2254 , G2257 , etc.
outline: I, me, my

tokens.definition: ἀγαπάω agapáō, ag-ap-ah'-o; perhaps from ἄγαν ágan (much) (or compare H5689 ); to love (in a social or moral sense):—(be-)love(-ed). Compare G5368 .
outline: of persons to welcome, to entertain, to be fond of, to love dearly
to welcome, to entertain, to be fond of, to love dearly
of things to be well pleased, to be contented at or with a thing
to be well pleased, to be contented at or with a thing

tokens.definition: ἐν en, en; a primary preposition denoting (fixed) position (in place, time or state), and (by implication) instrumentality (medially or constructively), i.e. a relation of rest (intermediate between G1519 and G1537 ); "in," at, (up-)on, by, etc.:—about, after, against, + almost, × altogether, among, × as, at, before, between, (here-)by ( + all means), for (… sake of), + give self wholly to, (here-)in(-to, -wardly), × mightily, (because) of, (up-)on, (open-)ly, × outwardly, one, × quickly, × shortly, (speedi-)ly, × that, × there(-in, -on), through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), under, when, where(-with), while, with(-in). Often used in compounds, with substantially the same import; rarely with verbs of motion, and then not to indicate direction, except (elliptically) by a separate (and different) preposition.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: in (1,: 902x), by (163x), with (140x), among (117x), at (113x), on (62x), through (39x), miscellaneous (264x).
outline: in, by, with etc.

tokens.definition: ἀλήθεια alḗtheia, al-ay'-thi-a; from G227 ; truth:—true, × truly, truth, verity.
outline: objectively what is true in any matter under consideration truly, in truth, according to truth of a truth, in reality, in fact, certainly what is true in things appertaining to God and the duties of man, moral and religious truth in the greatest latitude the true notions of God which are open to human reason without his supernatural intervention the truth as taught in the Christian religion, respecting God and the execution of his purposes through Christ, and respecting the duties of man, opposing alike to the superstitions of the Gentiles and the inventions of the Jews, and the corrupt opinions and precepts of false teachers even among Christians
what is true in any matter under consideration truly, in truth, according to truth of a truth, in reality, in fact, certainly
truly, in truth, according to truth
of a truth, in reality, in fact, certainly

what is true in things appertaining to God and the duties of man, moral and religious truth in the greatest latitude the true notions of God which are open to human reason without his supernatural intervention
in the greatest latitude

the truth as taught in the Christian religion, respecting God and the execution of his purposes through Christ, and respecting the duties of man, opposing alike to the superstitions of the Gentiles and the inventions of the Jews, and the corrupt opinions and precepts of false teachers even among Christians
subjectively truth as a personal excellence that candour of mind which is free from affection, pretence, simulation, falsehood, deceit
truth as a personal excellence that candour of mind which is free from affection, pretence, simulation, falsehood, deceit
